title: Frog Species Identification
description: Leap into this quiz about the colorful and diverse world of frogs and toads

questions.question: Which group of small, brightly colored frogs from Central and South America are among the most toxic animals on Earth?
Which frog species is the largest in the world, weighing up to 7 pounds and found in Cameroon and Equatorial Guinea?
Which frog has translucent skin on its belly, allowing you to see its internal organs including its beating heart?
Which large toad, originally from Central and South America, was introduced to Australia in 1935 and became an invasive pest?
Which frog species is famous for its bright red eyes and is an iconic symbol of tropical rainforests?
Which frog can survive being frozen solid during winter and thaw out alive in spring?
Which type of frog carries its tadpoles on its back and deposits them in small pools of water collected in bromeliad plants?
Which extremely large North American frog has a deep, resonant call that sounds like 'jug-o-rum'?
Which tiny frog from Papua New Guinea is one of the world's smallest vertebrates at just 7.7 millimeters long?
Which popular pet frog from Australia is plump, docile, and known for its friendly temperament?
Which aquatic frog from Africa is completely flat, lacks a tongue, and uses its front limbs to shovel food into its mouth?
Which North American frog gets its name from the spotted pattern on its skin that resembles a big cat?
Which golden-colored frog from Colombia is considered the most poisonous animal in the world?
Which European frog species is notable because the male wraps strings of eggs around his hind legs and carries them until they hatch?
Which toad has a distinctive high-pitched whistling call and runs rather than hops, and is the rarest amphibian in Britain?
